Package com.github.tommyettinger.digital

Class RoughMath

java.lang.Object
com.github.tommyettinger.digital.RoughMath
public final class RoughMath extends Object
Fast approximations of math methods that reach roughly the right answer most of the time. Ported from fastapprox, which is open source under the New BSD License.

  • Method Details

    • pow2Rough

      public static float pow2Rough(float p)
      Approximates Math.pow(2.0, p) with single-precision, somewhat roughly.
      Parameters:
      p - the power to raise 2 to; can be any float
      Returns:
      an approximation of 2 raised to the p power; can be any float greater than 0

    • pow2Rougher

      public static float pow2Rougher(float p)
      Approximates Math.pow(2.0, p) with single-precision, very roughly.
      Parameters:
      p - the power to raise 2 to; can be any float
      Returns:
      an approximation of 2 raised to the p power; can be any float greater than 0

    • expRough

      public static float expRough(float p)
      Approximates Math.pow(Math.E, p) with single-precision, somewhat roughly.
      Parameters:
      p - the power to raise E to; can be any float
      Returns:
      an approximation of E raised to the p power; can be any float greater than 0

    • expRougher

      public static float expRougher(float p)
      Approximates Math.pow(Math.E, p) with single-precision, very roughly.
      Parameters:
      p - the power to raise E to; can be any float
      Returns:
      an approximation of E raised to the p power; can be any float greater than 0

    • log2Rough

      public static float log2Rough(float x)
      Approximates the logarithm of x with base 2, using single-precision, somewhat roughly.
      Parameters:
      x - the argument to the logarithm; must be greater than 0
      Returns:
      an approximation of the logarithm of x with base 2; can be any float

    • logRough

      public static float logRough(float x)
      Approximates the natural logarithm of x (that is, with base E), using single-precision, somewhat roughly.
      Parameters:
      x - the argument to the logarithm; must be greater than 0
      Returns:
      an approximation of the logarithm of x with base E; can be any float

    • log2Rougher

      public static float log2Rougher(float x)
      Approximates the logarithm of x with base 2, using single-precision, very roughly.
      Parameters:
      x - the argument to the logarithm; must be greater than 0
      Returns:
      an approximation of the logarithm of x with base 2; can be any float

    • logRougher

      public static float logRougher(float x)
      Approximates the natural logarithm of x (that is, with base E), using single-precision, very roughly.
      Parameters:
      x - the argument to the logarithm; must be greater than 0
      Returns:
      an approximation of the logarithm of x with base E; can be any float

    • sinhRough

      public static float sinhRough(float p)
      Approximates Math.sinh(p), somewhat roughly. Wikipedia's page on hyperbolic functions may be useful.
      Parameters:
      p - the argument to sinh; can be any float
      Returns:
      an approximation of the hyperbolic sine of p; can be any float

    • sinhRougher

      public static float sinhRougher(float p)
      Approximates Math.sinh(p), very roughly. Wikipedia's page on hyperbolic functions may be useful.
      Parameters:
      p - the argument to sinh; can be any float
      Returns:
      an approximation of the hyperbolic sine of p; can be any float

    • coshRough

      public static float coshRough(float p)
      Approximates Math.cosh(p), somewhat roughly. Wikipedia's page on hyperbolic functions may be useful.
      Parameters:
      p - the argument to cosh; can be any float
      Returns:
      an approximation of the hyperbolic cosine of p; can be any float greater than or equal to 1

    • coshRougher

      public static float coshRougher(float p)
      Approximates Math.cosh(p), very roughly. Wikipedia's page on hyperbolic functions may be useful.
      Parameters:
      p - the argument to cosh; can be any float
      Returns:
      an approximation of the hyperbolic cosine of p; can be any float greater than or equal to 1

    • tanhRough

      public static float tanhRough(float p)
      Approximates Math.tanh(p), somewhat roughly. Wikipedia's page on hyperbolic functions may be useful.
      Parameters:
      p - the argument to tanh; can be any float
      Returns:
      an approximation of the hyperbolic tangent of p; between -1 and 1 inclusive

    • tanhRougher

      public static float tanhRougher(float p)
      Approximates Math.tanh(p), very roughly. Wikipedia's page on hyperbolic functions may be useful.
      Parameters:
      p - the argument to tanh; can be any float
      Returns:
      an approximation of the hyperbolic tangent of p; between -1 and 1 inclusive

    • logisticRough

      public static float logisticRough(float x)
      Approximates the standard logistic function, somewhat roughly. This is also called the sigmoid function, or expit. It is the same as tanhRough(float), scaled, with an offset.
      Parameters:
      x - the parameter to the standard logistic function; can be any float
      Returns:
      an approximation of the logistic function of x; between 0 and 1 inclusive

    • logisticRougher

      public static float logisticRougher(float x)
      Approximates the standard logistic function, very roughly. This is also called the sigmoid function, or expit. It is the same as tanhRougher(float), scaled, with an offset.
      Parameters:
      x - the parameter to the standard logistic function; can be any float
      Returns:
      an approximation of the logistic function of x; between 0 and 1 inclusive

    • sinRoughLimited

      @Deprecated public static float sinRoughLimited(float x)
      Deprecated.
      Use TrigTools.sin(float) instead, for any input range.
      Approximates Math.sin(x) in the domain between -PI and PI, very roughly. This can produce results that are outside the correct range of sine.
      Parameters:
      x - the argument to sin; must be between -PI and PI
      Returns:
      an approximation of the sine of x; between -1 and 1 inclusive (this can go out of range)
      See Also:
      • TrigTools has several sine approximations, and all are more precise than this.

    • sinRough

      @Deprecated public static float sinRough(float x)
      Deprecated.
      Use TrigTools.sin(float) if you need very fast sine approximation.
      Approximates Math.sin(x) over its full domain, very roughly. This can produce results that are outside the correct range of sine.
      Parameters:
      x - the argument to sin; can be any float
      Returns:
      an approximation of the sine of x; between -1 and 1 inclusive (this can go out of range)
      See Also:
      • TrigTools has several sine approximations, and all are more precise than this.
